questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The student left the school with scarcely a protest.
The student left the school without scarcely a protest.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: As Mark waited at the station, a woman took his package. He yelled and she fled.
As Mark waited at the station, a woman takes his package. He yelled and she fled.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Growling and barking, the dog tore up the coat while the man watched helplessly.
Growling and barking, the man watched helplessly as the dog tore up the coat.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The boys failed to do anything constructive all day.
The boys failed to do nothing constructive all day.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: There is nothing no one can do about the weather.
There is nothing anyone can do about the weather.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Throw your friend a piece of candy from the train.
Throw your friend from the train a piece of candy.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: He was not often on time for meetings.
He usually arrived late for meetings.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The man saw a boy who was breaking the window. He was very tall.
The man saw a very tall boy breaking the window.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The boy saw a very skinny man driving a yellow car.
The boy saw a man who was driving a yellow car. He was very skinny.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Driving near the train tracks, the train whistle blared. John closed the car's window.
As John drove near the train tracks, he heard the train whistle blare. He closed the car's window.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The exhaust from the car smells bad.
The exhaust from the car smells badly.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: The witness saw a woman who was wearing a blue dress running from the scene of the accident.
The witness saw a woman running from the scene of the accident. She was wearing a blue dress.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: Laughter came from the spectators as they watched the show.
Watching the show, laughter came from the spectators.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: I will always remember the night my house burned down.
The night my house burned down will always be remembered.

questions.questionText: Choose the passage below that is most clear.

options.text: For years, police have cited bad driving as the main cause for accidents.
Police have cited bad driving for years as the main cause for accidents.
